unnormalised: **Automotive News: Boosting Fuel Efficiency on Indian Roads**
normalised: **Automotive News: Boosting Fuel Efficiency on Indian Roads**

unnormalised: New Delhi - With rising fuel prices, automotive manufacturers and consumers in India are increasingly focused on fuel efficiency. Experts at IIT-Madras are researching advanced engine technologies aimed at improving mileage by up to 15% in existing petrol and diesel vehicles.
normalised: New Delhi - With rising fuel prices, automotive manufacturers and consumers in India are increasingly focused on fuel efficiency. Experts at I I T-Madras are researching advanced engine technologies aimed at improving mileage by up to fifteen percent in existing petrol and diesel vehicles.

unnormalised: Dr. Sharma, lead researcher, emphasized the importance of lightweighting vehicles through innovative material usage, reducing the overall weight by approx. 50 kg per car. Government subsidies are now available under the "Atmanirbhar Bharat" scheme for research into alternative fuels and electric vehicle technologies.
normalised: Doctor Sharma, lead researcher, emphasized the importance of lightweighting vehicles through innovative material usage, reducing the overall weight by approximately fifty kilogram per car. Government subsidies are now available under the "Atmanirbhar Bharat" scheme for research into alternative fuels and electric vehicle technologies.

unnormalised: Furthermore, tyre manufacturers like MRF are developing low rolling resistance tyres, claiming improvements of around 3-5 kmpl. Consumers are also advised to maintain their vehicles properly; regular servicing, correct tyre pressure (as per manufacturer recommendations), and avoiding aggressive driving can significantly impact fuel consumption. Even clearing out unnecessary items in the car (reducing weight) can help. Remember, saving fuel saves you Rs. and reduces emissions, benefiting both your wallet and the environment. Carpooling, especially in congested cities like Mumbai, also contributes to lowered fuel consumption and eases traffic on our roads. Even small changes like using smaller parking spaces of 100 sq ft help.
normalised: Furthermore, tyre manufacturers like M R F are developing low rolling resistance tyres, claiming improvements of around three to five kilometer per liter. Consumers are also advised to maintain their vehicles properly; regular servicing, correct tyre pressure (as per manufacturer recommendations), and avoiding aggressive driving can significantly impact fuel consumption. Even clearing out unnecessary items in the car (reducing weight) can help. Remember, saving fuel saves you rupees and reduces emissions, benefiting both your wallet and the environment. Carpooling, especially in congested cities like Mumbai, also contributes to lowered fuel consumption and eases traffic on our roads. Even small changes like using smaller parking spaces of one hundred square feet help.
